DOC.brief_title: Seoul National University Prospectively Enrolled Registry Prostate Cancer With Active Surveillance
DOC.detailed_description: Prostate cancer ( PCa ) remain one commonly diagnose malignancy men worldwide . Early diagnosis definitive therapy seem improve oncological outcome men high-risk disease , significant concern exist term overdiagnosis overtreatment patient lower-risk tumor . In context , active surveillance ( AS ) recently emerge alternative treatment strategy PCa patient low risk cancer . However , publish data base Western population different protocol , therefore ; well-controlled data well-organized prospective cohort urgently need Korean patient low-risk PCa Korean patient significantly different tumor characteristic compare Western patient . Here , investigator plan establish Seoul National University Enrolled Registry Prostate Cancer Active Surveillance , finally provide concrete evidence clinical outcome active surveillance program primary therapeutic strategy low-risk PCa Korean men .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Men < 80 year 2 . Pathologically proven adenocarcinoma prostate transrectal prostate biopsy ≥ 10 core 3 . PreBx PSA ≤ 10ng/ml 4 . PSA density < 0.15ng/ml/ml 5 . Clinical stage T12a 6 . Biopsy Gleason score ≤ 6 7 . No . positive core ≤ 2 8 . Maximum cancer involvement one core ≤ 20 % . 9 . No PIRADS 5 lesion multiparametric prostate MRI ( 1.5T 3T ) 10 . Participants must willing attend followup visit T1ab disease confirm systematic TRUSBx ≥ 10 core 1 . A former therapy prostate cancer .
